availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles T. Taylor (Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and French consular)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and French consular. Native of France. Married to Catherine Taylor. Father of Theodora Taylor, Samuel Taylor, Henry Taylor, M. S. Taylor, and Catherine A. M. Taylor. Election officer for the Fifth Ward of Louisville in 1848. Louisville leader of the American Party from 1856 to 1857. Consul of the French Consulate in Louisville in 1857.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Seventh Ward, p. 22. "Officers of Elections," The Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), November 6, 1847, p. 3. "Important Change," The Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), May 7, 1858, p. 1. Federal Mortality Census Schedules, 1850-1880, and Related Indexes, 1850-1880, Archive Collection: T655, Archive Roll# 15, Census Year: 1870, Census Place: Louisville, Jefferson, Kentucky, Page: 734. Edwards' Annual Director . . in the City of Louisville for 1865-6 (Louisville: Edwards, Greenough, & Deved, 1865), p. 561.
